measured_by: barycentric weight S computed from change between personal estimate and social information
justification: The authors state: "We define ... the sensitivity to social influence S ... as the (barycentric) weight they give to the average M ... With this definition, the second estimate is hence given by X_s = (1 − S)X_p + S M."

measured_by: absolute value of the median log-normalised estimates |Median_i,q(X_i,q)|
justification: Under Impact of τ on estimation accuracy the paper specifies: "(i) collective accuracy as |Median_{i,q}(X_{i,q})|, where i runs over individuals and q over quantities."

measured_by: median of absolute log-normalised estimates Median_i,q(|X_i,q|)
justification: The same section explains: "(ii) individual accuracy as Median_{i,q}(|(X_{i,q})|). Values closer to 0 ... indicate better accuracy for both measures."

measured_by: log ratio X = log(E/T) of estimate to true value
justification: In Results – Distribution of estimates, the authors note: "We therefore use the quantity X = log(E/T ) as our variable of interest ... X represents the deviation from the truth in orders of magnitude."
